SENT.plain: A 50-year-old man with a history of renal cell carcinoma was admitted with ventricular tachycardia
Echocardiography showed a mass in the apex of the left ventricle
Cardiac magnetic resonance confirmed a mass infiltrating the anterior-apical wall of the left ventricle
This is the first case describing an association between ventricular tachycardia and renal cell carcinoma metastatic to the left ventricle
